title: Sahelanthropus tchadensis
description: One of the earliest known hominins; possibly walked upright with both ape-like and human-like traits.

title: Australopithecus afarensis
description: Lived in East Africa; walked upright; one of the best-known early human species. Famous specimen: 'Lucy'.

title: Homo habilis
description: Among the first tool users; had a larger brain than earlier species. Known as the 'handy man'.

title: Homo erectus
description: Used more advanced tools, stood fully upright, and had body proportions similar to modern humans. First hominin to use fire and migrate out of Africa.

title: Homo neanderthalensis
description: Close cousins to modern humans; adapted to cold climates; buried their dead and made tools.

title: Homo sapiens
description: Originated in Africa and spread worldwide; developed complex language, art, and technology.

title: Cave Art Flourishes
description: Humans began creating symbolic cave art, showing advanced creativity and culture.

title: Agricultural Revolution
description: Humans shifted from hunting-gathering to farming, leading to permanent settlements.
